Chapter 4 - Font Manager / Font Manager Reference
Routines

Disabling Font Scaling

The SetFScaleDisable procedure enables or disables font scaling of bitmapped glyphs. When font scaling is enabled, the Font Manager can scale a bitmapped glyph that is present in the System file to imitate the appearance of a bitmapped glyph in another point size that is not present. For more information about scaling of bitmapped fonts, see "The Scaling Process for a Bitmapped Font" on page 4-21.
